Visuals\, Audio\, World Building\, all coalesce to form a stunningly beautiful post-apocalyptic world.The bad\, The Ugly\, The Lunacy.This game had a lot to live up to\, and quite frankly it failed miserably in the one aspect that people loved about the predecessor so much; the writing.The first game admitably had little in ways of a clever/ interesting plot\, and yet it remains as a prime example of a masterclass in pacing and consistency. TLoU2 has nothing in comparison to the first game's narrative delivery.One too many times I was left asking why and how\, all for the wrong reason. One too many times the plot and narrative progression just feel so oxymoronically stupid that anyone would be remiss if they thought this writing can make for a good story\, let alone any semblance of likeability in any of the cast in this game.Not many games have left me\, my family\, friends\, coworkers\, online acquaintances all saying the same remark in regards to a fictional work; "Somebody wrote this... somebody actually wrote this and said it's fine to shove it out the door?"\, this game is sadly one such example.Neil Druckmann claimed that he and his team broke conventions with this game's narrative when all he did is show how confused he is in how to follow up the first game at best\, pander to his own writer's ego at worst.Dual narrative with players going through the opposite sides of the narrative has been done prior; Halo 2's arbiter missions felt shoehorned to most and yet it was well done and further helped built the Halo universe\, GTA 5 pretty much forced players to contend with some characters they'll likely find unlikeable and yet persisting through them all end up with some levity and ultimately a sense of satisfaction\, etc.The only way someone can rightly claim this game as breaking convention is if they consider wasting their target audience's time as such a feat.If you want a satisfying narrative experience\, even the newly release Ghost of Tsushima does it better than this game... and the former's overall narrative is neither clever or groundbreaking\, yet it's a rewarding and wholesome experience in comparison.… Expand
